lead_paragraph: Human-caused global warming has made severe droughts like the ones this summer in Europe, North America and China at least 20 times as likely to occur as they would have been more than a century ago, scientists said Wednesday. abstract: The Times analyzed temperature data from weather stations across the United States. The result: 2021 was a huge year for records, both high and low.
snippet: The Times analyzed temperature data from weather stations across the United States. The result: 2021 was a huge year for records, both high and low.
lead_paragraph: Temperatures in the United States last year set more heat and cold records than any other year since 1994, according to a New York Times analysis of weather station data.

headline.main: We Mapped a Year of Extreme Weather

abstract: The finding, by European researchers, fits a clear warming trend: The seven hottest years on record have been the past seven.
snippet: The finding, by European researchers, fits a clear warming trend: The seven hottest years on record have been the past seven.
lead_paragraph: Last year was Earth’s fifth hottest on record, European scientists announced on Monday. But the fact that the worldwide average temperature didn’t beat the record is hardly reason to stop worrying about global warming’s grip on the planet, they said.

headline.main: 2021 Was Earth’s Fifth-Hottest Year, Scientists Say
headline.print_headline: Last Year  Was One  Of Hottest On Record

abstract: Emissions rose 6 percent last year after a record 10 percent decline in 2020, fueled by a rise in coal power and truck traffic as the U.S. economy rebounded from the pandemic.
snippet: Emissions rose 6 percent last year after a record 10 percent decline in 2020, fueled by a rise in coal power and truck traffic as the U.S. economy rebounded from the pandemic.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — America’s greenhouse gas emissions from energy and industry rose 6.2 percent in 2021 as the economy began recovering from pandemic lows and the nation’s coal plants roared back to life, according to a preliminary estimate published Monday by the Rhodium Group.

headline.main: U.S. Greenhouse Gas Emissions Bounced Back Sharply in 2021
headline.print_headline: U.S. Greenhouse Gas Emissions Bounced Back Sharply in 2021

abstract: There’s less snow and stricter rules, but skiers are adjusting in surprising ways.
snippet: There’s less snow and stricter rules, but skiers are adjusting in surprising ways.
lead_paragraph: STEVENS PASS, Wash. — Skiing is an endangered sport, caught between a warming planet and a global pandemic. But there’s a boom in one corner of the ski world that’s being driven, at least in part, by a combination of climate change and Covid.

headline.main: Here’s How Climate Change and Covid Are Transforming Skiing
headline.print_headline: Amid Climate Change and Covid, U.S. Skiers Find a Way to Adjust

abstract: In Virginia, cabinet nominees are rarely blocked. But the Republican governor-elect’s choice of Andrew Wheeler to be natural resources secretary has alarmed Democrats.
snippet: In Virginia, cabinet nominees are rarely blocked. But the Republican governor-elect’s choice of Andrew Wheeler to be natural resources secretary has alarmed Democrats.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A rare confirmation battle is brewing around the nomination of Andrew Wheeler, who ran the Environmental Protection Agency under President Donald J. Trump, to take a similar role in an incoming Republican state administration in Virginia.

headline.main: Virginia Democrats Aim to Block Trump’s E.P.A. Chief From State Agency
headline.print_headline: Democrats in Virginia Plan to Block Selection Of Former Trump Aide

abstract: Politicians have called for a pause in new mining contracts for lithium, which is in high demand for electric car batteries but is at the heart of a debate in Chile over mines, water rights and inequality.
snippet: Politicians have called for a pause in new mining contracts for lithium, which is in high demand for electric car batteries but is at the heart of a debate in Chile over mines, water rights and inequality.
lead_paragraph: SAN PEDRO DE ATACAMA, Chile — Plans to expand lithium mining in Chile, the world’s second largest producer, hit political roadblocks this week, raising new questions about supplies of a metal that is in high demand as the world transitions away from fossil fuels and toward renewable energy sources.

headline.main: Mining of Lithium, Key to the Climate Fight, Faces New Scrutiny in Chile
headline.print_headline: Incoming Chile President Faces Thorny Decisions On Lithium Extraction

abstract: Simultaneous high levels of the two pollutants, which harm human health, are occurring with increasing frequency, researchers say.
snippet: Simultaneous high levels of the two pollutants, which harm human health, are occurring with increasing frequency, researchers say.
lead_paragraph: Dangerous levels of two air pollutants, ozone and smoke, are occurring in tandem with increasing frequency over widespread parts of the Western United States where millions of people live, researchers said Wednesday.

headline.main: Health Risks of Smoke and Ozone Rise in the West as Wildfires Worsen
headline.print_headline: Harmful Pollutants Converge in the West as Fires Worsen

abstract: There’s potential political trouble on the horizon for the president.
snippet: There’s potential political trouble on the horizon for the president.
lead_paragraph: President Biden couldn’t persuade Congress to pass major climate legislation in 2021, and it looks like his plans to slash America’s planet-warming pollution could face an even harder path this year.

headline.main: Why the Coming Months Will Be Critical for Biden’s Climate Plan

abstract: When the Bootleg fire tore through a nature reserve in Oregon this summer, the destruction varied in different areas. Researchers say forest management methods, including controlled burns, were a big factor.
snippet: When the Bootleg fire tore through a nature reserve in Oregon this summer, the destruction varied in different areas. Researchers say forest management methods, including controlled burns, were a big factor.
lead_paragraph: SILVER LAKE, Ore. — When a monster of a wildfire whipped into the Sycan Marsh Preserve here in south-central Oregon in July, Katie Sauerbrey feared the worst.

headline.main: This Vast Wildfire Lab Is Helping Foresters Prepare for a Hotter Planet

abstract: Mounting challenges will make the coming months critical for the president’s environmental agenda, analysts say.
snippet: Mounting challenges will make the coming months critical for the president’s environmental agenda, analysts say.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the new year opens, President Biden faces an increasingly narrow path to fulfill his ambitious goal of slashing the greenhouse gases generated by the United States that are helping to warm the planet to dangerous levels.

headline.main: Biden ‘Over-Promised and Under-Delivered’ on Climate. Now, Trouble Looms in 2022.
headline.print_headline: As Challenges Mount, Biden’s Climate Legacy Races Against Clock

abstract: In Martin County, Ky., where coal production has flatlined, entrepreneurs are promising that a new solar farm atop a shuttered mine will bring green energy jobs.
snippet: In Martin County, Ky., where coal production has flatlined, entrepreneurs are promising that a new solar farm atop a shuttered mine will bring green energy jobs.
lead_paragraph: MARTIN COUNTY, Ky. — For a mountain that’s had its top blown off, the old Martiki coal mine is looking especially winsome these days. With its vast stretches of emerald grass dotted with hay bales and ringed with blue-tinged peaks, and the wild horses and cattle that roam there, it looks less like a shuttered strip mine and more like an ad for organic milk.

headline.main: Coming Soon to This Coal County: Solar, in a Big Way
headline.print_headline: Peak Pillaged  For Coal Gets Solar Upgrade
